data.title: Promising Practice: Technical Assistance
data.excerpt: Carrie Broadus, owner of Pot Luck Enterprises, took advantage of Los Angeles’ technical assistance program to learn how to navigate the local permitting process and form a locally verified equity business. Broadus now uses the knowledge gained from the technical assistance program to advocate for cannabis equity in her community.

og_meta.site_description: Learn about California cannabis laws and licenses
og_meta.page_description: Carrie Broadus, owner of Pot Luck Enterprises, took advantage of Los Angeles’ technical assistance program to learn how to navigate the local permitting process and form a locally verified equity business. Broadus now uses the knowledge gained from the technical assistance program to advocate for cannabis equity in her community.
og_meta.meta_description: Carrie Broadus is the owner of Pot Luck Enterprises in Los Angeles, a non-storefront retailer. Broadus took advantage of Los Angeles’ technical assistance program to learn how to navigate the local permitting process and form a locally verified equity business. Broadus now uses the knowledge gained from the technical assistance program to assist other applicants through the licensing process and advocate for cannabis equity in her community.
og_meta.open_graph_description: Carrie Broadus, owner of Pot Luck Enterprises, took advantage of Los Angeles’ technical assistance program to learn how to navigate the local permitting process and form a locally verified equity business. Broadus now uses the knowledge gained from the technical assistance program to advocate for cannabis equity in her community.

Broadus now uses the knowledge gained from the technical assistance program to advocate for cannabis equity in her community.
